explanation: the preamble (for exporting)
entity 0 claiming that 1 is true; any kind of quotation basically
explanation_nd: entity 0 states that 1 is true

explanation: 0 is the reason why 1 is true; note that 0 and 1 could be formulas talking about the past stating that something was the reason why something was the case at some point in time
explanation_ph: formula1 is reason for formula2 (p → q; p; q)

explanation: there is a causal relation where 0 would make 1 true; this also covers speculations about how things could have been if past events would have gone differently
explanation_ph: formula1 would be reason for formula2 (p → q)
explanation_nd: formulas 0 and 1 are connected by some causal (can be a third factor that is not mentioned) relation so that if 0 were true, 1 would also be the case

explanation: entity 0 says that 1 is desirable
explanation_ph: entity wants: formula should be made true
explanation_nd: entity 0 states verbally or by making a certain choice, giving arguments … for 1 to be the case

explanation: 0 should be made true; this 'should' is distinct from specifying uncertainty
explanation_nd: formula 0 should be made true

explanation: it is possible that 0 is true; in the sense that nothing prevents 0 from being true
explanation_nd: 0 may be the case

explanation: 1 is/would be bad for concept 0
explanation_ph: formula would be bad for entity
explanation_nd: 0 would or does harm 1

explanation: 1 is bad for entity 0
1 is/would be good for concept 0
explanation_ph: formula would be good for entity
explanation_nd: 0 would or does benefit 1

explanation: 1 is good for entity 0
entity 0 believes 1 is true
explanation_nd: 0 believes that 1 is true

explanation: entity 0 has the ability to perform action 1
explanation_nd: 0 could do 1

explanation: 0 usually implies 1; in the sense that it might not always be the case but one can assume it is unless evidence for the contrary is presented
explanation_nd: when 0 is true, 1 tends to also be true

explanation: in situation/point in time 0 1 was/is/would be the case; e.g. 'in the industrial revolution {1}'; so named points in time together with something that was or will be the case there
situations 0 and 1 are similar
concepts (people or situations) 0 and 1 are similar; e.g. Hitler comparisons or comparing the brexit referendum to some other vote
explanation_nd: 0 is similar to 1

explanation: entity 1 prefers 2 to be true over 0; e.g. utterances like 'xy would rather have 0 than 2'
explanation_nd: entity 1 prefers 0 over 2 (without necessarily wanting either of them to be true)

explanation: entity 0 is accused of being biased
entity 0 is accused of being somehow unqualified to make meaningful contributions to the dialogue; e.g. 'idiot'
entity 0 should make 1 true
explanation_nd: 0 should do 1

explanation: entity 0 is accused of lying about truth of 1; 0's beliefs about 1 don't reflect what 0 said about 1
explanation_ph: entity lies about formula (since entity's beliefs contradict formula)
explanation_nd: 0 deliberately lies about topic or proposition 1

explanation: entity 0 is morally bad and should be condemned; ad-hominem-catchall
explanation_nd: 0 is a bad person

explanation: truth of 0 is necessary for 1 to be true
explanation_nd: 1 can only be true if 0

explanation: if 0 then 1; note that if truth of 0 is said to be responsible/cause truth of 1 then it would rather be pattern 1
explanation_nd: If 0 is true, 1 is also true, but the relation need not be causal

explanation: entity 0 is claimed to be part of entity 1 (most likely some group)
explanation_ph: entity is part of entity group
explanation_nd: entity 0 belongs to group 1

explanation: all entities in entity 0 have property 1 e.g. brexit supporters are idiots
explanation_nd: all members of group 0 have property 1 or would do 1 in a given situation

explanation: entity 2 is claimed to be part of group/entity 0 whose members generally know truth of 1; e.g. as a scientist I know that this is true
explanation_ph: entity is part of entity group; entity group usually believes formula
explanation_nd: entity 2 belongs to group 0, and 0 have expertise knowledge indicating that 1 is the case

explanation: falsity of formula 0 is claimed
explanation_nd: 0 is not true

explanation: entity 0 is claimed to be honest w.r.t. formula 1 in the sense that they say what they believe
explanation_nd: entity 0 is honest about topic/ proposition 1

explanation: by executing action 0 truth of 1 would be eventually achieved
explanation_nd: if action 0 were taken, 1 would become true at some point in the future

explanation: entity 0 executed action 1
explanation_nd: entity 0 did 1

template: [\{?0 : entities\};\{{?1 : \text{list of lists of }actions}\} : {?2 : entities}]({?3 : formula})
explanation: the entities 0 can collaborate to enforce truth of 3 as long as entities 2 execute one of the (joint) actions from 1
explanation_ph: entity1 can enforce formula if entity2 executes action
explanation_nd: if  group 2 did 3, this would allow group 0 to do 1

explanation: most entities in entity 0 have property 1 e.g. most brexit supporters are idiots
explanation_ph: most entities in entity group have property
explanation_nd: most members of group 0 share property 1

explanation: entity 0 claims that 1 might cause 2 to be true
explanation_ph: entity claims: formula1 is reason for formula2
explanation_nd: entity 0 states that 1 might bring about 2

explanation: entity 0 knows that 1 is true
explanation_ph: entity knows: formula is true (formula must be true)
explanation_nd: entity 0 is claimed to know that 1 is true

explanation: formula 0 is necessarily true in the sense that it cannot be the case that 0 is false
explanation_nd: it is impossible for 0 to not be true

explanation: formula 0 is permitted in the sense that it is morally acceptable to make 0 true or that 0 is true
explanation_nd: doing 0 would be morally acceptable

template: L_{{?0 : entity}} ({?1 : entity} \implies \downarrow x.\,O (x stit ({?2 : formula}))
explanation: entity 0 states that entities in group 1 should make 2 true
explanation_ph: entity1 wants entity2 to enforce formula
explanation_nd: entity 0 states that members of group 1 should do 2

explanation: entity 0 warns of 1 being bad
explanation_nd: entity 0 states that 1 is/would be bad

explanation: some entities in 0 have property 1
explanation_ph: some entities in entity group have property
explanation_nd: some members of 0 have property 1 (i.e. not nobody)

explanation: nobody in 0 has property 1
explanation_ph: none of the entities in entity group have property
explanation_nd: no member of 0 has property 1

explanation: entity 0 warns of bad consequences 2 of formula 1
explanation_ph: entity warns: formula 1 implies formula 2; formula 2 is bad
explanation_nd: entity 0 states that 1 has negative consequences 2 ( 1 could still be seen as the right thing to do overall)

explanation: 1 is/would be at least as good as 0
1 is/would be at least as good for concept 2 as 0
0 is/would be genereally good
0 is/would be generally bad
uncategorized queries
